note.p: Death: His house in Merrion Square, Dublin, Ireland (06 May 1889)
Education: Trinity College, Dublin. MB (1850), MD (1857)

Career: At the camp in Sebastopol, during the Crimean War; Demonstrator of Anatomy, Carmichael School of Medicine, Dublin (1856); Medical Superintendent, Mountjoy Government Prison (1857); Examiner in Anatomy and Physiology, Queen's University, Ireland; died of a ruptured aneurism
